metadata.title: CVE-2023-52600 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: jfs:fix uaf in jfs_evict_inode When the execution of diMount(ipimap) fails, theobject ipimap that has been released may be accessed in diFreeSpecial().Asynchronous ipimap release occurs when rcu_core() calls jfs_free_node().Therefore, when diMount(ipimap) fails, sbi->ipimap should not beinitialized as ipimap.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52600` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.8.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.8.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.8.0-7.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-7.7').
linux-aws package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
